channel.title: Custom items show up as objects?
channel.description: im relatively new and i thought id try my hand at adding customs to my 317. i added compiled and did all the shit fine, but when i logged onto my sever the custom showed up as an object when i wore it. ex: a fence, the top of a roof ect ect. idk what the problem is can someone help me out here?

item.title: Custom items show up as objects?
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Your client sided ints suck.

Read full topic
item.source: Custom items show up as objects?

item.title: Custom items show up as objects?
item.dc:creator: @haksilence haksilence
item.description:
@haksilence wrote:

the before mentioned problem was solved but i have a new problem.
(i coded primal armour into my 317) all are working except helm and legs. helm shows up modeled corectly but apears in the wrong slot (weapon slot) even though i have added it to the helm section server side. and the legs, when equiped, just turn inv.
i have checked the modeles afiliated with the legs using rsmv and they are correct. whats the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom items show up as objects?
item.dc:creator: @haksilence haksilence
item.description:
@haksilence wrote:

thanks i knew i was forgettting something dumb!!!
i got another problem. i added a barrelchest anchor. it shows up in my inv (not very clean, but the inv model works) but when i wield i go inv

edit*
i adde models and got several working but one of them (primal legs) shows up as inv. i checked the models on rsmv and its the correct model used in the ints and ive added the model via “add model #####” starting to get super frustrated.

Read full topic
item.source: Custom items show up as objects?

item.title: Custom items show up as objects?
item.dc:creator: @PvPXSlayer PvPXSlayer
item.description:
@PvPXSlayer wrote:

did you add the models when u were logged in?

when you are logged into your server, for any new model to be registered it must be
added to the game.

you can do so like this:

::add model “filepath”
::add model “ID”
add model “ID”
add models (adds every model in the folder)

Read full topic
